59.name: weapon attack
59.effect: Use your weapon to hit a target. To hit a target you must give 2 dice. Then when doing damage removing damage from the target based on its Armor and Ward.

60.name: spell casting
60.effect: Gain Soul Strain to Cast a spell from your Spell list. Soul Strain cost and dice cost depend on spell.

61.name: use an item
61.effect: Use an item from your bag, or is within 1 tile of you in the world.

62.name: move
62.effect: Spend a dice to move your Speed. Swimming and Climbing use two tiles instead of 1.

63.name: hide
63.effect: Roll Thieving, Pick the top 3 dice. A creature must meet or beat these 3 dice values to see you.

64.name: search
64.effect: Roll your Core Skill. Pick the top 3 dice. If you meet or beat the dice values of the hidden creature they are no longer Hidden.

65.name: grapple
65.effect: Roll a Contested Body Check against a target within 1 tile of you. If you succeed then the target is Grappled.

66.name: push
66.effect: Roll a Contested Body Check against a target within 1 tile of you. If you succeed then the target is pushed 3 tiles away from you.

67.name: overwatch
67.effect: Make a Melee Attack at the first target that moves within your weapon range.

68.name: lock
68.effect: You may Lock any unused dice at the end of your Turn.

69.name: manipulate
69.effect:
Combine two dice. If the combination is 7 or more, set 1 dice as a 6 and the other as the remainder.
(3+4= 6,1) You can only do this once per turn and only in combat.

70.name: monk 1:
70.effect:
When you get this you may use your Level instead of a set skill plus 2. 
Set your Unarmed Damage to 2. 
Your unarmored Armor Score is the same as Light Armor. You still retain the benefits of being unarmored.

71.name: monk 2:
71.effect:
Your Unarmed Attacks can damage Incorporeal things as if you where Incorporeal.
Set your Unarmed Damage to 4. 
Your unarmored Armor Score is the same as Medium Armor. You still retain the benefits of being unarmored.

72.name: monk 3:
72.effect:
You have achieved inner balance, perfect hegemony inside yourself.
Using 2 dice you can purify yourself of curse and various other negative effects.
Additionally, you can not be knocked prone unless you allow it.
Set your Unarmed Damage to 6. 
Your unarmored Armor Score is the same as Heavy Armor. You still retain the benefits of being unarmored.

73.name: meditate
73.effect: You can spend 1 hour meditating to cleanse half your Soul Strain.

74.name: power attack
74.effect: If a 6 was spent doing an Attack it does an extra damage.

75.name: stance fighting group
75.effect: Gain the following traits: Pushing Strike, Feint, and Bash. This trait costs 2 trait points. You may only select this trait at level 1.

76.name: barbarian fighting group
76.effect: Gain the following traits: Whirlwind Strike, Shredder, and Bull Rush.  This trait costs 2 trait points. You may only select this trait at level 1.

77.name: bloodhound
77.effect:
Gain 3 extra Speed when moving to a Marked creature.
This can be taken multiple times to increase the Speed by 2 each time this is taken.

78.name: strong punches
78.effect: When doing an Attack with a Fist Weapon the damage is equal to half your Level (rounded up)

79.name: climber
79.effect: Can move your Speed up vertical walls without needing to roll or spending extra Speed.

80.name: pushing strike
80.effect: Do a Melee Attack it has an additional 3 Knockback.

81.name: hearty
81.effect: Gain additional Max Health equal to your Body.

83.name: pitcher
83.effect: Double all range for Thrown items.

84.name: whirlwind strike
84.effect: Do a Melee Attack against all creatures within 1 tile of you. You can only do this once per turn.

85.name: bash strike
85.effect: Do a Melee Attack, this attack does no damage. Stun 3.

86.name: shredder
86.effect: Do a Melee Attack, this attack does no damage. Remove Armor equal to your damage. You can only do this once per turn.

87.name: feint
87.effect: Make a Weapon Attack. You may add 3 to one of the dice you use for the attack. At the end of your turn gain Stun 1. You can only do this once per turn.

88.name: quick runner
88.effect: Gain 1 extra Speed. This can be taken multiple times to increase the Speed by 1 each time this is taken.

89.name: bull rush
89.effect: Move up to half your speed in a strait line in any direction. Do a Body Contest against any creature within 1 tile during the move. On Success knock the creatures back 3 tiles away from your path.

90.name: endure
90.effect: Gain 2 Temporary Health. This cannot be done while you have Temporary Health.

91.name: disarm
91.effect: Do a Melee Attack, this attack does no damage. If the target is holding a weapon they drop the weapon and it goes 3 tiles away.

92.name: critical strike
92.effect: Do a Melee Attack. Roll a dice on a 5 or 6 it does Double damage. Otherwise it does normal damage. This can only be done once per turn.

93.name: deaths reaper
93.effect: When you kill a creature with a Melee Attack. Gain an additional Dice.

94.name: deaths knock
94.effect: While on Death’s Door you do an extra 2 damage from Weapon Attacks.

95.name: defender
95.effect: When you use Overwatch and you hit a creature. That creature’s Speed is set to 0 and gets Webbed this turn.

96.name: fortify
96.effect: Gain a Stack of Armor. You cannot gain more than 3 Armor from this trait per Rest.

97.name: combo finisher
97.effect: If you hit the same creature twice this turn you can do another Weapon Attack.

98.name: blessed/cursed caster
98.effect: You have been gifted with power. You can cast Bless or Weak Curse using 1 Soul Strain instead of 2, and all spells you cast do an extra 1 damage to Undead.

99.name: powerful smites
99.effect: When you cast Smite, increase its damage by half your Soul rounded up.

100.name: protected
100.effect: When you are put on Death’s Door, gain 2 stacks of Ward.

101.name: spell combo
101.effect: Cast a Damaging Melee Spell. After hitting with this Melee Spell, take the lowest die spent on the spell and the other given die to make a Melee Weapon Attack. This cannot be done more than once per turn.

102.name: tactician group
102.effect: You gain the following traits: Think Ahead, Command, and Motivate.  This trait costs 2 trait points. You can only select this trait at level 1.

103.name: marksman group
103.effect: You gain the following traits: Crippling Shot, Dodge, and On Guard.  This trait costs 2 trait points. You can only select this trait at level 1.

104.name: mental mage
104.effect: If your Max Soul Strain is 0 it becomes 2. If it is higher, increase it by 1.

105.name: on guard
105.effect: If you end your turn without Attacking/Damaging anything. Go on Overwatch for free.

106.name: mark
106.effect: Mark a target for 3 turns. (Marked Targets cant become hidden and loose 1 Armor if they have Armor) [Marking an already Marked Target has no effect except to reset the duration of Marked]

107.name: motivate
107.effect: Target a creature you can see. Give the target the dice you used on this skill. This can be used outside of Combat when rolling a dice for a check.

108.name: dodge
108.effect: When you get hit spend your Locked dice to move 1 tile in any direction, avoiding the attack if you are no longer in range of the attack.

109.name: crippling shot
109.effect: Do a Ranged Attack, on hit, reduce the target’s Speed by 2.

110.name: think ahead
110.effect: Split a dice. Cannot split a 1.

111.name: deadeye
111.effect: Spend 2 1’s to hit a target with a Ranged Attack. This cannot be used more than once in a turn. This can be taken multiple times to increase the number of times you can do this in a turn.

112.name: weakspot
112.effect: When a Creature attacks a Creature you Marked they may add 1 to a dice roll once per turn.

113.name: marking shot
113.effect: Do a Ranged Attack, it gives them Marked for 2 turns on hit. This cannot be used more than once in a turn.

114.name: command
114.effect: Give an ally the ability to attack (2 dice) or move (1 dice). You cannot use this ability more than once per turn.

115.name: covering fire
115.effect: Make a Ranged Attack. On hit stop the target from being able to do Overwatch, cast spells, or do actions until the start of their turn.

116.name: train of thought
116.effect: If you don't have a locked die at the end of your turn lock a 3.

117.name: change of thinking
117.effect: Set a dice to 4. You can do this once per turn.

118.name: size up
118.effect: Target a creature you can see. You determine which of the targets Primary Skills (Body | Mind | Soul) are highest and lowest. You do not know the values of these Skills.

119.name: coordinated attack
119.effect: Make a Weapon Attack aginst a single target. An ally within 1 tile of the target may spend their locked dice and the bonus dice spent on this trait to make an attack against the same target.

120.name: fast hands
120.effect: You ignore the Loading trait of Ranged Weapons.

121.name: enhanced motivate
121.effect: When you use Motivate, increase the dice’s value by 1. This effect doesn’t apply if the dice is already 6.

122.name: recalculate
122.effect: You may flip this dice to show its opposite face. (1⇔6, 2⇔5, 3⇔4) You can only do this once per turn. This can be done outside of Combat for checks.

123.name: collateral
123.effect: Damage up to 3 creatures in a strait line with a Ranged Weapon Attack.

124.name: outsmart
124.effect: During the enemy’s turn replace a creatures dice with the one given.

125.name: tracking shot
125.effect: Go on Overwatch with a Ranged Weapon.

126.name: illusion of choice
126.effect: You can Manipulate twice a turn instead of once.

127.name: kite
127.effect: When you land an attack. You may then move half your Speed.

129.name: rundown
129.effect: When an enemy moves within half your Speed; you can spend your locked dice to move half your Speed.

130.name: reposition
130.effect: When an ally attacks; you can spend your locked dice to move half your Speed.

131.name: mind reader
131.effect: Attempt to force your mind into another creature's mind that you can see. Roll a Contested Mind check. On success you can read the creatures surface thoughts. Additionally, you can roll another Contested Mind check to look for some information the creature may have memories about. You can only be bound to one creature at a time.

132.name: mind over matter
132.effect: When you take damage you can spend your Locked dice and gain Stun 1 and negate the damage. This does not negate other effects such as Knockback or Ward removal.

133.name: telekinetic mind
133.effect: You learn the spells Telekinesis, Phantom Fishing Rod, and Poprocks if you don't already know them. Additionally, you can cast Telekinesis for only 1 Soul Strain instead of 3.

134.name: telepathy
134.effect: Bind your mind to a willing creature's mind. You can use your action on later turns to see/hear through their senses or send/receive simple messages. You can only be bound to one creature at a time.

135.name: dreams of the future
135.effect: At the end of a Rest roll a number of dice equal to your Level and Lock one of the dice.

136.name: yoyo
136.effect: Move your Speed. At the end of the turn teleport back to where you started the turn.

137.name: soul ward
137.effect: When you take damage you can gain Ward 1, and gain 2 Soul Strain, then take the damage. This effect cannot happen if you are at max Ward.

138.name: soul manipulator
138.effect: While soul is your Core Skill, Triple your Soul when Calculating Max Soul Strain instead of Doubling it.

140.name: focused
140.effect: You do not lose Focus from taking damage.

141.name: shaped explosions
141.effect: Cast an area of effect spell. When you do, you can choose up to 3 creatures within the area. Those creatures succeed on the save without needing to roll.

142.name: reactive explosions
142.effect: When you do an area of effect spell, you can set one of the required dice to 5 (You still spend 3 dice, you just change 1 dice).

143.name: soul shielded
143.effect: You can have a maximum of 4 Ward instead of 3. Additionally, gain an additional Ward on Rest.

144.name: soul bind
144.effect: You bind an object or weapon to your very soul. The object gains Returning and if it's a weapon you can do Soul Attack Roll instead of its default Stat attack roll. You must still meet the minimum requirements to use the weapon.

145.name: soul stealer
145.effect: When you kill an enemy with a non-spell Melee Attack, Cleanse 2.

146.name: past and future
146.effect: You can now Lock two dice. When you would Lock a dice while having two Locked you may pick which Locked dice to replace.

147.name: glimpse into the future.
147.effect: You can Lock dice when outside of Combat. Dice locked this way are removed from the roll pool.

148.name: foresight
148.effect: When you lock a dice, increase its value by 2. This effect cannot increase a dice’s value over 6.

150.name: lucky
150.effect: When you roll a 1 you can re-roll that dice. You can only do this once per Rest.

151.name: skeleton key
151.effect: You can lockpick without needing tools. Additionally, you roll an extra dice when you lockpick with tools.

152.name: backstab
152.effect: Do a Melee Attack, it does an extra 1 Damage. The Attack gains Armor Penetration if it does not already have it. You can only do this once per turn. This can be taken multiple times to increase the bonus damage by 1 each time this is taken.

153.name: silent scaling
153.effect: You make no noise while climbing or falling up to half your Speed.

154.name: shadow walk
154.effect: While you are Hidden or unseen you may turn Invisible. This Invisibility lasts until the start of your next turn.

155.name: imposing
155.effect: You can use Body instead of Charm when deceiving or intimidating someone.

156.name: slap back
156.effect: Spend your locked dice when using this trait. Make a Melee attack on a creature who has hit you with a Melee attack.

157.name: strangle hold
157.effect: While you have a creature Grappled. They cannot cast spells or speak.

158.name: get rough
158.effect: You can push creatures a number of tiles based on your Body +1 instead of just 3 tiles.

159.name: off balance
159.effect: Successful Push actions reduce the targets Speed by half.

160.name: larceny
160.effect: Roll a contested Body Check against a target within 1 tile of you. On success you wrestle an item away from the target.

161.name: redirect
161.effect: When you get hit spend your Locked dice to redirect the attack to a creature within 1 tile of you. You cannot do this if there are no creatures within 1 tile of you.

162.name: in the shadows
162.effect: When you kill a creature while hidden you do not become revealed.

163.name: spell copying
163.effect: If you see a spell being cast by someone else, you temporarily know that spell for 60 seconds (6 turns) regardless of if you know the spell innately.

164.name: spell disarmament
164.effect: You can cast Dispel Magic with Thieves’ tools without gaining Soul Strain.

165.name: silencing strike
165.effect: Make a Weapon Attack. Until the end of the target’s next turn they are unable to cast spells.

166.name: spell thief
166.effect: If you successfully Counterspell a Spell. You can Cast that spell for half its Soul Strain cost (rounded up) on your next turn.

167.name: body possession
167.effect: You can take over another humanoids living body for up to 10 minutes. The effected creature must be unconscious and will wake up if it takes damage. At the end of the effect, if you choose to leave the body, or if the creature wakes up from damage, you are booted to the nearest safe tile next to the creature. You cannot enter the same creature for 1 day after using this effect on them.

168.name: hunter
168.effect: Roll Nature instead of Thievery when Hiding.

169.name: nature speak
169.effect: You can have simple conversations with animals, and can use Nature instead of Charm when talking to them.

170.name: natures friend
170.effect: You can cast Beast Bond without gaining Soul Strain.

171.name: draw roots
171.effect: Heal 1. You must be standing on soil or stone to do this. You can do this a number of times equal to your Nature stat (max 6) per Rest.

172.name: natures bind
172.effect: You can Grapple someone using earth or plants within 4 tiles of you instead of having touch. All other rules still apply to the Grapple.

173.name: thorny armor
173.effect: You may spend your Locked dice to do Nature (Rounded down) to a creature that has hit you with a Melee attack.

174.name: marked as prey
174.effect: Targets you Mark, take 1 extra damage from all sources while Marked.

175.name: hunters pride
175.effect: You know the location of all Marked enemies you have marked regardless of distance. Additionally, Marks you place only disappear once you dispel it or the Marked creature dies.

176.name: animal form
176.effect: You can transform into an animal that you have seen. The creature must have a Difficulty Rating (DR) your Nature or lower. The Shapeshift lasts until dispelled or you die. While transformed you replace your Stats, Skills, Armor and Speed with the Animals. Your Health and Ward remain unchanged.

177.name: ignite
177.effect: Your damaging cantrips apply 1 stack of Burn.

178.name: frostbite
178.effect: When you effect a creature with Stun, Frozen, or effects that reduce movement, deal 1 damage to them.

179.name: crystalize soul
179.effect: Whenever you gain Soul Strain from the result of casting a spell. Gain 1 Armor for every 2 Soul Strain gained. This effect goes away the next time you are hit or after 10 minutes.

180.name: improved animal form
180.effect: When you Transform through the use of the Animal Form Trait you can gain half of the Creature’s Health as Temporary Health. You can do this once per Rest. The Temporary Health does not go away if you transform back into your normal self.

181.name: stronger flames
181.effect: Non-cantrip Spells that apply Burn apply an additional stack of Burn.

182.name: frozen bomb
182.effect: Target up to 3 Creatures you can see. Those targets loose all stacks of Stun, and Frozen. Burst 1 centered on those creatures.  All creatures within this area creatures take an amount of damage equal to the Stun stacks lost.

183.name: updraft
183.effect: Whenever you gain Soul Strain you gain the Flight trait (Move your speed in the air) until end of your turn.

184.name: taunt
184.effect: Make a Contested Charm roll against a creature you can see. On success the creature cannot willingly move away from you and must spend a dice to move closer if possible.

185.name: fearsome roar
185.effect: All targets within 1 tile of you must make a Charm Roll against the 3 dice given when casting. All creatures that failed cannot willingly move towards you, and must spend a dice to move away from you.

186.name: death's howl
186.effect: When you are put on Death’s Door, release a Howl within 3 tiles of you. All creatures cannot willingly move towards you, and must spend a dice to move away from you.

187.name: distract
187.effect: Make a distraction within Range 6. Make a Contested Charm roll against a creature you can see. On success the creature cannot willingly move away from the distraction and must spend a dice to move closer if possible.

188.name: misdirection
188.effect: When talking to a creature you can state a clearly false statement. Then do a contested Charm roll against a creature. On success the creature believes whatever sentence you said regardless of how true it was. This effect lasts for 1 hour. After which they may or may not still believe the lie.

189.name: pull the strings
189.effect: Choose a creature within range, They immediately make a weapon attack against another creature of your choice within their weapon range. They use the dice given for this attack.

190.name: ventriloquism
190.effect: Do a contested Soul roll against a creature within range 6. On success you make the target recites a sentence as well as it can and in the same tone. They believe the sentence was their own and have no memory of the magic. On failure they someone tried to cast magic on them but not what it was or who cast it.

191.name: positive influence
191.effect: When you cast a spell on an ally then their next dice roll is increased by 1. This does not go off on a 6.

192.name: negative influence
192.effect: When you cast a spell on an enemy then their next dice roll is decreased by 1. This does not go off on a 1.

193.name: intrusive soul
193.effect: You can cast Intrusive Thoughts without gaining Soul Strain. Additionally you can use Charm instead of Soul when using the save.

194.name: goad
194.effect: Make a Contested Charm roll against a creature you can see. On success the creature must make an attack against you, if its not in range it must spend a dice to move closer if possible. If the attack hits you gain Ward  1 then take the damage.

195.name: potion maker
195.effect: You can use Medicine instead of Crafting when making potions.

196.name: battle medic
196.effect:
You gain 4 Speed when moving to an ally who has 2 or less health.
This can be taken multiple times to increase the Speed by 3 each time this is taken.

197.name: blood magic
197.effect: You gain an amount of Spells equal to twice your Medicine. (When you cast a spell while at max Soul Strain, you take an amount of damage equal to how far you go over your max Soul Strain when casting.

198.name: improved healer
198.effect: When you use a Bandage use your full Medicine roll instead of half.

199.name: placebo
199.effect: Give a Creature within Range 6 an amount of Temporary Health equal to your Medicine. You can only do this up to half your Medicine (rounded up) per Rest.

200.name: recycled meds
200.effect: You no-longer use up Bandages and can use a Medkit twice before it is expent.

201.name: medical genius
201.effect: When you use a Medkit on a creature they gain all the benefits of a Rest except for fully healing. (Medkit healing is still the same)

202.name: resuscitate
202.effect: Touch a creature. You Reduce the target’s Death’s Door Count to go back to a 2 or less. Additionally, heal the creature as if you used a Medkit.

203.name: healthy hands
203.effect: When you cast the Healing Hands Spell use your full Medicine roll instead of half.

204.name: soul healer
204.effect: Touch a living creature, cannot target Undead or Constructs. The creature regains Half their max Health. You can do this once per Rest.

205.name: chain healing
205.effect: When you heal a creature you may heal another creature within 1 tile of them for half the healing (rounded down).

206.name: improvised weapon
206.effect: You can quickly make an improvised weapon. Spend 10 gold and pick a Core weapon, the improvised weapon has the stats of that weapon. It breaks after 4 uses loosing all gold spent in the process.

207.name: get creative
207.effect: You can quickly make a set of improvised tools. Spend 2 gold and pick a set of tools, you are able to use these tools for one crafting roll after which they break loosing all gold spent in the process.

208.name: trap maker
208.effect: Make one of 3 traps listed below. Each trap costs 5 gold to craft, and covers 1 tile or item. Traps can be reclaimed if unused. Tripwire: A small hidden wire which will knock over any creature that steps on it. Can trigger non magical items. Snare: A loop of rope that when triggered Grapples and lifts its prey 2 tiles up. Popmine: A plate that when activated knocks its prey 3 tiles in a direction. The direction is decided during the trap's creation.

209.name: tunneler
209.effect:
You can remove a number of tiles equal to your crafting stat. Different types of tiles cost more or less to dig through
(Cost : Tiles removed).
Soft (1:1), such as dirt or loose stones
Dence (2:1), such as stone walls
Reinforced (3:1), such as metal walls or solid stone

210.name: steam weapons
210.effect:
You can create 1 of 3 specialty weapons.
The Bronze Bolter; a repeating crossbow, the Steamthrower: a steam based Flamethrower, or the Clockwork Cannon; a large blunderbuss that shoots scrap. See Weapons for more info.

211.name: turreted weapon
211.effect:
Spend 2 dice to turn one of your weapons into a semi automated Turret. If the Turret is destroyed the weapon drops and is broken. The weapon can be picked up by you and returns to being a normal weapon.
You can control any number of Constructs with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the constructs move as well.

212.name: enchanted item
212.effect: You can spend 1 hour, which can be over the course of a rest, to imbue a spell into an item of your choice. The item gets an amount of Soul Strain equal to your level. Someone can then later cast this spell giving the item Soul Strain instead of the user. You can only have one spell in the item at a time, and you can only have 1 item with this effect.

213.name: simple golem
213.effect: You can create a Personal Golem (See Creatures). You can control any number of Constructs with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the constructs move as well.

214.name: golem ranger module
214.effect: Your Golem’s Soul Weapon gets +4 range and gains Armor Piercing. Additionally, it’s Armor Becomes Light

215.name: rune maker
215.effect:
You can craft 2 Runes of your choosing. You can only have 2 active at once any new rune will replace the oldest crafted rune. 
This skill can be taken multiple times to increase the number of active runes by 1.

216.name: combative runing
216.effect: You have figured out how to improve the flow of runic magic through your tools. Weapons you wield and armor you wear can have an additional rune inserted into it. Additionally, Craft a rune. This rune must be put in your weapon or armor.

217.name: magical siphon
217.effect: When you get a kill using a magic weapon or a weapon inscribed with a rune, you gain 1 Ward.

218.name: runic augmentation
218.effect:
You gain the ability to alter bodies with the aid of runes. By spending 10 minutes writing runes on yourself or others, you can grant a creature one of the benefits listed below. Each creature can only have 1 rune alteration and the rune’s used for the change are visible somewhere on the body (can be hidden with clothing). 
Wings: 
Gills/Fins: 
Change Appearance:

219.name: blade wave
219.effect: You can Expel runic magic to create a wave of runic energy. Suppress the magic of one of your active runes to deal your Melee Weapons damage to all creatures in a 8 tile line. While suppressed the rune has no effect. This suppression lasts for 10 minutes.

220.name: scroll crafting
220.effect: You can create a magical scroll. This scroll can contain any Spell you know when crafting, and can be used by anyone with Magic (St). The person using the scroll can cast the spell on the scroll for half its St cost if they know the spell or at full cost if they don't. You can only have 1 scroll written at a time, if another one is written the first one loses its power.

221.name: spell manipulator
221.effect:
The next spell you cast this turn has one of the following:  
Soul Slinger, an extra 4 Range but gain 1 Soul Strain. 
Maintain Spell Form, the spells duration is increased by an extra 2 turns but gain 1 Soul Strain. 
Intensify Spell, do 1 extra damage but gain 2 Soul Strain.

222.name: simple golem
222.effect: You can create a Personal Golem (See Creatures). You can control any number of Constructs with your dice, but they must all be given the same Command. When you spend a dice to move you may also have the constructs move as well.

223.name: golem soulbound module
223.effect:
Your Golem gains the spell Swapper with a St cost of 1, however it only can target the Owner (you).
The Owner (you) can cast spells through the golem as if they (you) where the golem

299.name: fleeting
299.effect: yup its fleeting, you know why?
